node.label: Cohong Trade Bldg
node.sidebar: 公行 /// Cohong Trade Building is used as temporary storage for caravans and goods in transit through Sanjiazi. It is rumored some rare treasures are kept here, but Cohong bosses keep tight security in the area.

node.label: Precinct
node.sidebar: 缅 /// Mian government sentries are posted at Sanjiazi since the [[incursion event|sanjiaziplaza]] two years ago.

node.label: Qiandian
node.popup: 錢店 /// *Qiandian* "exchange house" is part of a local banking network not connected to 缅 /// Mian government. This local *qiandian* is heavily protected by the Mian government sentry presence, however.

node.label: Narrows
node.popup: Many in Sanjiazi were affected negatively by the [[incursion|sanjiaziplaza]] two years ago. Poverty is common and is accompanied by opium use, crime, and sex trade. Most of the survivors of Vex's slaughter at the Plaza, Sanjiazi's original people, live in the Narrows.

node.label: ZYZ Safe House
node.sidebar: A new criminal element has entered Sanjiazi following the tragedy of the [[incursion|sanjiaziplaza]]. 在阴影中 /// Zài Yinying Zhong (meaning "in the shadows"), or ZYZ operate in plain sight of the precinct. Bribery, forgery, and petty crimes are their typical *modus operandi*.

node.label: Fenghuang Tower
node.sidebar: 凤凰 /// Fenghuang (meaning "phoenix") is a 缅 /// Mian government shadow order of sorcery. They have established a quiet presence in Sanjiazi since the [[incursion|sanjiaziplaza]]. The tower is rarely approached by locals.

node.label: Sanjiazi Plaza
node.sidebar: In year 2 BYZ, Ulysses Vex and a band of Erinyes descend on Sanjiazi, slaughtering the villagers to a man. No one is left alive, including Fang Ro's parents. The Night Tigers, a kensei 缅 /// Mian soldier unit rushes in to defend the civilians but they are captured. Some are killed, others crucified. Present day Sanjiazi is settled by outsiders.

node.label: Fang Citadel
node.popup: Sanjiazi used to be a summer residence for ennobled 方 /// Fangs (at best indirect relation to Fang Ro's bloodline). Vex and his marauders destroyed the citadel during the [[incursion|sanjiaziplaza]] and executed any Fangs barricaded inside. The citadel was never rebuilt, and the Fangs never returned to Sanjiazi.

node.label: Pan Chicken Farm
node.popup: A chicken and livestock farm owned by the 潘 /// Pan family, whom the river inlet is named after.

node.label: Grain Farms
node.sidebar: Millet farms, wheat farms, and rice paddies owned by various families.

node.label: Boat House
node.sidebar: Local manufacture of fishing boats and rowboats for use on the 玄济 /// Xuán Ji river.

node.label: Sturgeon Fishing
node.popup: Fishing and hunting are common professions in Sanjiazi, and the 玄济 /// Xuán Ji river is teeming with activity, especially in the warmer months.

waypoint.label: Cohong Wagon Route
waypoint.popup: 公行 /// Cohong wagons carry spices, rum, and in rare cases opium and contraband. The Cohong are the source of the largest influx of gold into Sanjiazi. The trade masters are spenders, but they generally keep to themselves.

waypoint.label: Cohong Goods Dropoff
waypoint.popup: The Cohong wagon dropoff point at their trade house is often accompanied by heavy security and reinforced by 缅 /// Mian government sentries.

waypoint.label: NT Attack Path
waypoint.popup: 暗夜之虎 /// Night Tigers advance over a hill and down the bend into Sanjiazi to intercept Vex and his marauders.

waypoint.label: NT Bridge Massacre
waypoint.popup: 暗夜之虎 /// Night Tigers are unable to secure the main bridge. The kensei are captured, tortured, and the majority are crucified and killed.

waypoint.label: NT 2nd Squad Attack Path
waypoint.popup: A second squad of 暗夜之虎 /// Night Tiger kensei advance on Vex's marauders from the west.

waypoint.label: NT Plaza Breach
waypoint.popup: 暗夜之虎 /// Night Tigers cannot breach the blockade at the plaza. The soldiers are beaten back and killed in the streets.
